page.title: 16WAR AND PEACE IN GLENLUCE
page.content:
The Bombing Range is SW of Glenluce, marked {DANGER AREA.}Royal Aircraft Establishment West Freugh have watch towers to warn people going into the danger zone. They practise bombing and try out new bombs. The people who work there must sign the Official Secrets Act so the two R.A.E. workers who live in Glenluce cannot tell us anything. Real bombs are occasionally used.
Glenluce has now only one{church.}The minister, Rev G.Dickson, lives in the manse and is minister of New Luce too. Sunday Service is at 11.45am. At school Miss Stevenson runs{Scripture {Union}with Thursday lunch-time meetings and morning Torch Club for Bible study and prayer. At Wednesday Assembly we sing hymns, say prayers and hear talks about God.A Gospel Hall in North St has evangelical meetings.
